ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Shows how to create stacked mountain chart
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Generates a Stacked Mountain chart in code-behind. The [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.StackedMountainRenderableSeries.html']StackedMountainRenderableSeries API[/url] can be used to render mountain/areas stacked one above another.
Mountains are rendered using the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~Stroke.html']Stroke[/url] (outline) and [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseMountainRenderableSeries~Fill.html']Fill[/url] (fill).
[b][i]Tip![/i][/b]
Did you know we support 100% Stacked Mountain charts? See the [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17245/41/stackedcolumnrenderableseries---stack-columns-vertically-horizontally-and-100']Introduction to Stacked Series in SciChart[/url] article for more information.
